item.title: Report E-2025070421
item.description:
Report E-2025070421

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: MERIDIAN
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 10:02 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (UBI) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .25 ounce of Truck Restore (hazardous - UN2922) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. (SCM) insisted that they had all proper PPE and did not want a contractor out for such a small release. The terminal advised they will place the damaged jug of waste and oil-dri into a 25-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report I-2025060217
item.description:
Report I-2025060217

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: TWIN FALLS
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CHRISTENSEN, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1314
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver was completing a delivery to a customer's tank when the driver discovered the product pooling under the truck from the section of flex pipe developing a hole. The snow on the ground created a natural berm to contain the product on the customer's driveway. The hole began losing product after the PTO was engaged and the driver discovered the product pooling minutes after performing the delivery. Once the driver discovered the pooling, he turned off the pump and then ran to close the internals and prevent further loss. The driver then deployed booms and absorbents to contain the product. Our internal emergency response team was engaged and responded to the scene to further contain the spill and support the clean up efforts of True North Environmental.
